Name: Rhombic cosmetic palette with double-headed bull
Description: This large, rhombic greywacke cosmetic palette is topped by a double-headed bull. The legs and belly line of the animal are incised on both sides of the palette. One of the bull's heads has completely broken off. Three of the four eyes still have their inlay, a bead made of bone. The palette shows signs of wear on one side, caused by the grinding of pigment.
